snippet: Pfizer and Amgen teamed to develop drugs to mimic the effect, though it may take a decade or more before it is available to the public.
abstract: Study based on genetic testing of 150,000 people finds a rare mutation that protects even fat people from getting Type 2 diabetes; effect provides a promising new target for developing a drug to mimic the mutation's effect; findings appear in journal Nature Genetics.
lead_paragraph: Pfizer and Amgen teamed to develop drugs to mimic the effect, though it may take a decade or more before it is available to the public.

headline.main: Rare Mutation Kills Off Gene Responsible for Diabetes
headline.print_headline: Rare Mutation Kills Off Gene Responsible for Diabetes
